page.title: 15CLEATOR MOOR - THE TOWN
page.content: Cleator Moor is a fairly new town, having grown up in the 19th century to house the influx of people seeking work in the iron ore mines.Most of these came from Ireland which has left a strong Irish lilt in the accent and many Irish traditions. The mines were worked out long since and there are many remains to be seen. Some of them were dug too close to the surface of the ground and caused a great deal of subsidence. Large areas of housing had to be pulled down for safety after cracks big enough to pass toast through to neighbours appeared in house walls. The path of the old railways remain and can be walked along. These were dismantled when the mining finished. The people in Cleator Moor are very kind, friendly and generous, although perhaps a rather tight-knit community.
